chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of a Child

result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel M Rivera-Nieves was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Court will allow defendant to earn good time.
Consecutive to: Counts 2 & 3

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges by the end of probation period. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. If revoked, court costs, fees and surcharges to be paid through collection by the department of corrections from 25% of funds.

No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 16 years, excluding the children living in the residence.
No contact with the victim L.T. dob 10-17-2000.

Cooperate with any orders in the childrens court case 14JC535.
Obtain/comply with sex offender evaluation and treatment. Court ordered the case manager in the 14JC535 case to have access to the evaluation results. Provide DNA sample (unless previously submitted) and pay surcharge. 
Court will defer ruling on sex offender registration until the review hearing date on 8-14-15.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant report to the House of Corrections on August 16, 2014 between 8:00am and 10:00am. Subject to verification by the House of Corrections, Court will allow release for work when called, counseling appointments as ordered by childrens court order, and vocational training classes as needed for employment.
Consecutive to: to Count1 1, 2, & 3 with credit for 64 days time served

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Samuel M Rivera-Nieves in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Sara Beth Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Agent Thomas Slater. Court declines to order registry.

Defendant Samuel M Rivera-Nieves in court.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Agent Thomas Slatter appeared. No appearance by defense counsel. Case adjourned for a review hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Samuel M Rivera-Nieves in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Cindy Davis for  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Agent Georgette Gehring appeared. Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 7.  Review hearing scheduled for 02-29-2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Samuel M Rivera-Nieves not in court.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
No appearances by parties.  Case adjourned for a review hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for 08-27-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Samuel M Rivera-Nieves in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for sentencing hearing. Defendant's car was broken into last night. Items in the car as well as papers he had prepared for court were stolen. Defense counsel requests adjournment to allow defendant to assemble the papers for court again. Defendant may file a police report for the break in. Court grants defense request for adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Samuel M Rivera-Nieves in court with attorney Michael L Chernin.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for sentencing hearing. Defense counsel informs the court there is a CHIPS proceeding in which the defendant is a party scheduled for 7/29/14. Defense counsel requests an adjournment of the sentencing hearing until after that date. State does not object. Court will grant request for adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

14RM031149  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06/20/2014

Arguments heard as to bail. Additional statements by Sabrina R. Court granted defense motion and reduced cash bail to $500.00 cash bail. Court ordered the defendant to have absolutely no contact with the victim. Justice Point is to verify defendant's residence and that he has secured employment. At the next court date, defendant is to bring a letter from employment supervisor with contact information and days, locations, and hours of employment. Court further ordered the defendant comply with all Children's Court orders.

Defendant sworn in. 
As to COUNTS 1 as AMENDED, 2, 3 & 4- 
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgments of conviction entered. Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing. Court vacated jury trial date of 8/13/14. Case adjourned to Branch 25. Sentencing Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 8:30 a.m.

Defendant Samuel M Rivera-Nieves in court with attorney Michael L Chernin.  Defendant Samuel M Rivera-Nieves in custody.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State filed an amended information. Defendant charged as follows:

COUNT 1- Fourth Degree Sexual Assault, contrary to sec. 940.225(3m) Wis. Stats., a Class A Misdemeanor.
COUNT 2- Fourth Degree Sexual Assault, contrary to sec. 940.225(3m) Wis. Stats., a Class A Misdemeanor. 
COUNT 3- Fourth Degree Sexual Assault, contrary to sec. 940.225(3m) Wis. Stats., a Class A Misdemeanor. 
COUNT 4- Fourth Degree Sexual Assault, contrary to sec. 940.225(3m) Wis. Stats., a Class A Misdemeanor.  

Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of amended information. Court read amended information into the record and informed defendant of maximum possible penalties.
State's Notice of Expert Testimony received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Samuel M Rivera-Nieves in court with attorney Michael L Chernin.  Defendant Samuel M Rivera-Nieves in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.  
Case set for arraignment. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court read defendant maximum possible penalties. Defense counsel has received discovery and is waiting for an offer from the State. State informed the Court of additional investigation that may lead to further charges against the defendant. Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates. Any motions that require testimony are to be filed by 05/20/2014 and will be argued on the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 13, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Samuel M Rivera-Nieves in court with attorney Michael L Chernin.  Defendant Samuel M Rivera-Nieves in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Erin Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
No ADA or DA file in Court.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Arraignment scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LT dob 10/17/00

Defendant Samuel M Rivera-Nieves in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Defendant Samuel M Rivera-Nieves in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
